description.text: This option defines the action to be taken.

choice.choiceText: Creates an MLD session, requires the use of -handle.
Modifies an MLD session, requires the use of -handle.
Deletes an MLD session, requires the use of -handle.
Disables an MLD session, requires the use of -handle.
Enables an MLD session, requires the use of -handle.
Enables all MLD sessions on port, requires the use of -handle.
Disables all MLD sessions on port, requires the use of -handle.

restriction.value: create modify delete disable enable enable_all disable_all

description.text: Number of sessions to create on the interface.
Configure MLDv2 Include Filter Mode.

choice.choiceText: The specified source(s) is (are) of interest
The specified source(s) is (are) not of interest

description.text: If 1, respond to general queries received on the interface.
If 1, respond to group specific queries received on the interface.

This parameter is mandatory for all modes, when using NGPF (it specifies the stack on which to add the mld host). For NGPF Backwards Compatibility for legacy HLT syntax support, if -mode is create, delete, modify, enable or disable this option is required to specify the existing MLD session.

This parameter is used only for NGPF Backwards Compatibility for legacy HLT sytax (only when -port_handle is given).

A handle or list of the handles that are returned from the interface_config call. These provide a direct link to an already existing interface and supercede the use of the intf_ip_addr value.

Starting with IxNetwork 5.50 this parameter accepts handles returned by pppox_config procedure in the following format: |,-, ... The PPPoX ranges are separated from the Interface Index identifiers with the (|) character. The Interface Index identifiers are separated with comas (,). A range of Interface Index identifiers can be defined using the dash (-) character.

Ranges along with the Interface Index identifiers are grouped together in TCL Lists. The lists can contain mixed items, protocol interface handles returned by interface_config and handles returned by pppox_config along with the interface index.

Example:count 10 (10 MLD routers). 3 pppox range handles returned by ::::pppox_config. Each pppox range has 20 sessions (interfaces). If we pass -interface_handle in the following format: [list $pppox_r1|1,5 $pppox_r2|1-3 $pppox_r3|1,3,5-9,13] The interfaces will be distributed to the routers in the following manner:

  • MLD Router 1: $pppox_r1 -> interface 1
  • MLD Router 2: $pppox_r1 -> interface 5
  • MLD Router 3: $pppox_r2 -> interface 1
  • MLD Router 4: $pppox_r2 -> interface 2
  • MLD Router 5: $pppox_r2 -> interface 3
  • MLD Router 6: $pppox_r3 -> interface 1
  • MLD Router 7: $pppox_r3 -> interface 3
  • MLD Router 8: $pppox_r3 -> interface 5
  • MLD Router 9: $pppox_r3 -> interface 6
  • MLD Router 10: $pppox_r3 -> interface 7
  • MLD Router 11: $pppox_r3 -> interface 8
  • MLD Router 12: $pppox_r3 -> interface 9
  • MLD Router 13: $pppox_r3 -> interface 1
  • 3Valid for mode create

This argument determines if individual interface, session or router handles are returned by the current command. This applies only to the command on which it is specified. Setting this to 0 means that only NGPF-specific protocol stack handles will be returned. This will significantly decrease the size of command results and speed up script execution. The default is 0, meaning only protocol stack handles will be returned.
Enable/disable mld host
This argument is used for Enable/Disable the mld host item with it's corresponding item handle.
IP address of the test interface / emulated mld Host.
Used to increment IP address.
Address prefix length.
If 1, enable IP Router Alert Option.
MAC address to be set on the interface.
The incrementing step for the MAC address to be set on the interface. This option is valid only when IxTclNetwork API is used.
If 1, use -max_response_time to overwrite the value obtained from the received Query message.
Set the maximum response time (in 1/10 seconds) on receipt of a query. If set to 0, immediately respond to received Query message.
Indicates the MLD protocol version to be used.

choice.choiceText: MLD v1
MLD v2

description.text: The number of multicast MLD groups to be advertised during each time period. A value of 0 disables this feature and transmits all groups immediately for all updates. Valid only with IxTclNetwork API. Used for MLDv2 only.
The interval (in ms) used for throttling updates. Use the value 0 to send messages as fast as possible.
Neighbor's interface IP address.
Neighbor's interface IP address increment step for creating multiple sessions. Default is 0, i.e. same IP address for all sessions.

If this option is enabled, the interface existence check is skipped but the list of interfaces is still created and maintained in order to keep track of existing interfaces if required. Using this option will speed up the interfaces' creation. Valid only for IxTclNetwork API.

If this option is enabled, the list of interfaces wont be created and maintained anymore, thus, speeding up the interfaces' creation even more. Also, it will enable -override_existence_check in case it wasnt already enabled because checking for interface existence becomes impossible if the the list of interfaces doesnt exist anymore. Valid only for IxTclNetwork API.
This option is required to specify the port where to take the action.
Resets the MLD Host configuration on port.
The interval (in seconds) to wait before re-sending the host's initial report of membership in a group. If 0, do not send unsolicited report.

Enables vlan on the directly connected MLD router interface. Valid options are: 0 (disable) / 1 (enable). This option is valid only when -mode is create or -mode is modify and -handle is a MLD router handle. This option is available only when IxNetwork tcl API is used.

choice.choiceText: Disables the vlan configuration
Enables the vlan configuration

description.text: VLAN ID for emulated router node.
For multiple neighbor configuration, configures the VLAN ID mode to be fixed or increment.

choice.choiceText: Same vlan id across interfaces
Increment vlan ids across interfaces

description.text:
When -vlan_id_mode isset to increment, this defines the step for every VLAN. When vlan_id_step causes the vlan_id value to exceed it's maximum value the increment will be done modulo number of possible vlan ids. Examples:

  • vlan_id = 4094; vlan_id_step = 2; -> new vlan_id value = 0
  • vlan_id = 4095; vlan_id_step = 11; -> new vlan_id value = 10
VLAN user priority assigned to emulated router node.
The name of the protocol stack.
Unsolicited Response Mode.
No. of Join/Leave messages to send per operation
Enable IPTV
Name of NGPF element, guaranteed to be unique in Scenario
Time in milliseconds between sending a Leave for the current channel and Join for the next channel.
The maximum time that is allowed for a multicast stream to arrive for channel for which a Join has been sent.
The maximum time allowed for a multicast stream to stop for a channel for which a Leave has been sent.
Use Zap Only to change channels without viewing the channel or Zap and View to change traffic and receive traffic for the last channel.

choice.choiceText: Enables channel change without viewing the channel
Change and receive traffic for the last channel
Enabled a single channel change

description.text: Specifies the direction of changing channels.

choice.choiceText: Switching is done starting from the first multicast group to the last one in ascending order.
Switching is done starting from the first multicast group, then in descending order from the last group.
Switching between multicast groups is done randomly.

description.text: Interval in milliseconds between channel changes based on the selected type.
Number of channels to change before stopping on a channel and watching it for View Duration.
Specifies the time in milliseconds to view the last channel.
Enable Global Settings for MLD protocol.
No. of Reports per Second
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action (rate = count/interval)
Time in milliseconds between Join messages from clients within the same range.
Specifies the wait interval type before changing the channels.

choice.choiceText: The interval is considered from sending the Join message to sending the Leave message for a multicast group.
The interval is considered from the time the multicast traffic for a group is received until the Leave message is sent for that group.

description.text: If enabled, the timestamps for Join and Leave failures are saved to a log file.
If enabled, General Query Response is send.
If enabled, Group Specific Response is sent
If enabled, Leave for current group and join for next group gets merged in a single multicast packet

returnValue.value: A list containing the mld host protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ethernet protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the ipv6 protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv6 client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the mld host iptv protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
If status is failure, contains more information
List of session handles Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.

notes.note: 1) MLD implementation using IxTclNetwork is NOT SUPPORTED in HLTAPI 3.30. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle, interface_handle, mld_iptv_handles

code_examples.example:
# Command :- ::ixiangpf::emulation_mld_config
# This command will create an MLD Host
set mld_host_1_status [::ixiangpf::emulation_mld_config \ -mode create \ -filter_mode include \ -general_query 1 \ -group_query 1 \ -handle <ipv6_handle> \ -active 1 \ -ip_router_alert 1 \ -max_response_control 0 \ -mld_version v2 \ -unsolicited_report_interval 120 \ -name {MLD Host 1} \ -unsolicited_response_mode false \ -join_leave_multiplier 1 \ -enable_iptv 0 \ -iptv_name {IPTV 1} \ -stb_leave_join_delay 0 \ -join_latency_threshold 5000 \ -leave_latency_threshold 5000 \ -zap_behavior zaponly \ -zap_direction up \ -zap_interval 5000 \ -num_channel_changes_before_view 5 \ -view_duration 60000 \ -zap_interval_type leavetoleave \ -log_failure_timestamps 0 \ -enable_general_query_response false \ -enable_group_specific_query_response false \ ]
# This command will generate ouput as given below # {status 1} {mld_host_handle mldHostHandle} # {mld_host_iptv_handle mldHostIptvHandle}
# This command will modify MLD host
set mld_host_1_modified [::ixiangpf::emulation_mld_config \ -handle <mld_host_handle> \ -mode modify \ -active 0 \ ]
# The command above will generate output as shown below: # {status 1}
